First attempt at utilizing Lucene to index the WebDAV properties (opposed to 
just the text in the Content).  This should work regradless of the actual 
backend storage medium as a lowest common denominator indexing solution.

creator: luetzkendorf@apache.org
text:
Hi Darren,
I now found some time to have a look on you proposal. 

I get running the indexer (index is created an updated, but deletion 
seems not work)

But I can't get it used in any search. You have implemented the "contains"
operator only but the contains operator means "contains in content" so 
I think with contains the node indexer is never asked.

Can you describe a configuration and give a sample query that does work?
Thanks, Stefan

creator: dhartford@ghsinc.com
text:
Hey Stefan,
Unfortunately you found my exact problem - I do not seem to have the knowledge 
needed to integrate the indexer with the Query tools.  I've done my best 
working with the Expression file to handle Lucene-specific searching, and have 
kept the 'contain' only as a reference until the Query's can actually start 
working (should be 'eq' rather than 'contain' really...).

Most of the work was derived from the TextContains classes so you should see a 
lot of similarity between the two. Hopefully I can get back to it with a 
clearer head at some point, if you can help with the little problem of 
integrating with the Query that would be a HUGE step!

Ok.
I will try to add a proposal in the next time.
Regards, Stefan
